definition: to get together all at once
(name of states and dynasties at several different periods)/surname Qi
neat/even/level with/identical/simultaneous/all together/to even sth out
to congregate/to assemble/to mass/to gather together/to amass/to polymerize
one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit

(main) hall/large room for a specific purpose/CL:間|间[jian1]/relationship between cousins etc on the paternal side of a family/of the same clan/classifier for classes, lectures etc/classifier for sets of furniture

sentences.english: During the Spring Festival, Chinese families will get together and have dumpling parties.
sentences.chinese: 每逢春節，中國家庭會齊聚一堂喫餃子。

sentences.english: We are here today to celebrate the fifth anniversary of Norbar Torque Tools (Shanghai).
sentences.chinese: 我們今天齊聚一堂，是爲了慶祝諾霸上海成立五週年。

sentences.english: People from all walks of life gathered nationwide to celebrate the time-honored holiday.
sentences.chinese: 各界人士齊聚一堂，慶祝這個歷史悠久的節日。

sentences.english: In fact this is the first time that a number of these leaders have ever met!
sentences.chinese: 事實上，這是第一次這麼多思想領袖能夠齊聚一堂。

definition: to cooperate on a great undertaking or joint project
pageant/distinguished meeting
Laibin prefecture-level city in Guangxi
guest/visitor
to gather happily under one roof
to collect/to compile/to converge/also written 彙集|汇集[hui4 ji2]
to arrive (esp. of notable person)/to visit (more formal than 光臨|光临[guang1 lin2])
to assemble/to concentrate/to mass/to build up/to marshal
teachers and students
to talk freely/to discuss without inhibition
convergence/to come together
dinner party/luncheon
charity event/public service activities
to gather (in a crowd)/to converge/to swarm
peak/apex/world best/number one/finest (competitors)/top (figures in a certain field)
leader/CL:個|个[ge4],位[wei4],名[ming2]
to have an informal discussion/CL:次[ci4],個|个[ge4]
